definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need

sentences.english: But two wrongs can never make a right, because two wrongs can never equal each other.
sentences.chinese: 冤冤相报永无终止，因为两种伤害永远不能抵消。

sentences.english: The accompanying ginger and plainly cooked broccoli also help offset the fat.
sentences.chinese: 配着的姜和简单烧过的西兰花菜也帮助抵消脂肪。
相差半个周期则引起抵消。

sentences.english: They cancel out the benefits of modernization. They break the bank.
sentences.chinese: 它们将抵消现代化的益处，并将耗尽资财。

sentences.english: Extra details and sidelights are set off in boxes.
sentences.chinese: 额外的细节和侧光被抵消在箱子里。

sentences.english: All the markups would cancel each other out.
sentences.chinese: 所有的涨价都会彼此抵消。

sentences.english: He ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard to counteract the list.
sentences.chinese: 他命令把左弦上所有的大炮移到右舷以抵消船的倾斜。

sentences.english: Doing so will help offset the harmful effects of urban pollution.
sentences.chinese: 这样做会抵消城市污染带来的影响。

sentences.english: The cache can countervail server load.
sentences.chinese: 缓存可以抵消服务器负载。

sentences.english: Your present behaviour cancels out any past help you gave us.
sentences.chinese: 你现在的行为抵消掉了过去你给我们的任何帮助。

sentences.english: This has easily offset the general decline in the birthrate of advanced countries.
sentences.chinese: 发达国家的出生率的普遍降低被轻易抵消。

sentences.english: There is the problem of cancelling out one another's forces among the states.
sentences.chinese: 国家之间存在着力量相互抵消的问题。

sentences.english: Rudder offset is simply adjusted by the length of the pushrod.
sentences.chinese: 鲁德尔抵消只是由推杆长度调整。

sentences.english: But they must not allow re-exportation then to the rich countries that need to recover the cost.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们要避免再次开发给富裕国家来抵消成本。

sentences.english: Nothing is pulling on you, only gravity.
sentences.chinese: 只有重力，没有推拉与之抵消。

sentences.english: The investment in the house by one person has been offset by the disinvestment of another.
sentences.chinese: 个人投资房屋同个人撤资相抵消。

definition: (literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to complement/to make up for a deficiency
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
